info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 08 at 3:26PM CDT until April 08 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE NORTHEAST PANHANDLES... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 11 PM CDT SATURDAY FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE NORTHEAST PANHANDLES... The National Weather Service in Amarillo has issued a Red Flag Warning for strong winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 10 AM to 11 PM CDT Saturday. * Affected Area...In Oklahoma...Texas and Beaver. In Texas... Hansford...Ochiltree and Lipscomb. * 20 Foot Winds...Northwest 20 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. West southwest winds 15 to 25 mph gusting to 35 mph on Saturday. * Relative Humidity...As low as 11 percent today. As low as 7 percent Saturday * Red Flag Threat Index...2 to 3 today. 2 to 5 on Saturday. * Timing...Through 8 PM today. From 10 AM to 11 PM CDT Saturday.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures will create favorable weather for rapid fire growth and spread. Avoid activities that promote open flames and sparks.
